thread.title: 'Straight Outta Compton' director F. Gary Gray set for 8th film in 'Fast & Furious' franchise
thread.title_full: 'Straight Outta Compton' director F. Gary Gray set for 8th film in 'Fast & Furious' franchise

title: 'Straight Outta Compton' director F. Gary Gray set for 8th film in 'Fast & Furious' franchise
text:
The Canadian Press - ONLINE EDITION 'Straight Outta Compton' director F. Gary Gray set for 8th film in 'Fast & Furious' franchise By: Lindsey Bahr, The Associated Press Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 at 4:04 PM | Comments: 0 Enlarge Image 
FILE - In this Aug. 10, 2015 file photo, director F. Gary Gray arrives at the Los Angeles premiere of "Straight Outta Compton" at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. Gray, who made waves this summer with his profitable and critically acclaimed N.W.A biopic, has been set to direct the 8th film in the Fast & Furious franchise. Gray announced the news on his Facebook page on Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. (Photo by John Salangsang/Invision/AP, File) 
LOS ANGELES, Calif. - F. Gary Gray, who made waves this summer with his profitable and critically acclaimed N.W.A biopic "Straight Outta Compton," has been set to direct the eighth film in the "Fast & Furious" franchise. 
Grey announced the news on his Facebook page on Thursday and Universal Pictures confirmed. 
Star and producer Vin Diesel posted a photo of himself and Gray with some "Fast & Furious" images on Facebook earlier this week, hinting that the "Compton" director was indeed the front runner to take over the extremely successful series. 
"Furious 7," released earlier this year, grossed a staggering $1.5 billion worldwide. James Wan directed that film, which featured Paul Walker's final appearance in the series. Walker died in 2013. 
The eighth installment is set for an April 14, 2017 release.
